question_sentence: Which platform announced that it will remove any misinformation related to vaccines?
Milwaukee Brewers pitcher Devin Williams will miss at least most of the playoffs after breaking his hand from:
choices: Doing the “milk crate challenge” on TikTok
Punching a wall after celebrating the team clinching the National League Central

question_sentence: Which business venture from the rap world opened this week?
choices: A vegan milkshake stand from Kelis called It’s Better Than Yours
A gourmet candy shop by 50 Cent where everything costs 50 cents
A restaurant from Eminem called Mom’s Spaghetti
A diner from A Tribe Called Quest called Ham ‘N’ Eggs

question_sentence: Wednesday was National Coffee Day. Which country drank the most coffee per capita in 2020?
Former Olympic swimmer Klete Keller pleaded guilty to obstruction in the Jan. 6 Capitol riot. He was identified in photos and video because:
choices: He was wearing a Team USA jacket
He kept telling the crowd he was an Olympian

question_sentence: This fire-damaged home in Massachusetts was listed on the market with an asking price of:
choices: $1. The owner just wants to stop having to pay property taxes.

question_sentence: Team USA dominated en route to a Ryder Cup victory. How many points did they win by?
This week a judge ruled that Britney Spears’ father is:
choices: Staying on as her conservator in a reduced role
Liable for any monetary losses Britney Spears has incurred over the last 13 years

question_sentence: Which former president broke ground on a center aiming to be a "premier institution" for developing the next generation of civic leaders?
Which of these menu items is McDonald’s bringing back?
What is the name of the Filipino boxer who has announced his retirement from the sport as he prepares to run for his country’s presidency next year?
evidence: The only eight-division world champion in boxing history, Pacquiao is quitting the ring at the age of 42 to take on Rodrigo Duterte in the May elections, after accusing the incumbent’s administration of fuelling corruption

question_sentence: Chicago-born singer R. Kelly was found guilty this week of one charge of racketeering and how many charges of sex trafficking?
evidence: A New York jury had heard how the I Believe I Can Fly chart-topper - real name Robert Sylvester Kelly - used his celebrity status to sexually abuse women and children in attacks spanning three decades

question_sentence: What is the name of the spiritual practice trending on TikTok that advocates claim can make dreams and ambitions become a reality purely through positive thinking?
evidence: Derived from the word ‘manifestation’, manifesting is the theory that we can all bring tangible change to our lives through positive thoughts, beliefs and emotions. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast

question_sentence: Germany’s centre-left Social Democrats (SPD) claimed a narrow victory over the party of outgoing chancellor Angela Merkel in Sunday’s federal election after winning what percentage of the vote?
evidence: Merkel’s Christian Democratic Union (CDU) party claimed 24.1% of the vote, followed by the Greens on 14.8%. As the SPD’s chancellor candidate Olaf Scholz began coalition talks, pundits predicted the negotiations might drag on for many weeks

question_sentence: The president of which country declared a state of emergency in its penitentiary system for the second time this year after more than 115 inmates were killed in a gang battle behind bars?
evidence: At least five inmates were beheaded in the riot on Tuesday at a prison in Guayas province. President Guillermo Lasso has promised to boost jail security and funding to tackle worsening behind-bars violence between rival gangs

question_sentence: What is the title of the new tell-all memoir by former White House press secretary Stephanie Grisham about the presidency of Donald Trump?
choices: I’ll Take Your Questions Now: What I Saw at the Trump White House
God Save America: an Insider’s View of Trump’s Troubled Reign
White House Woes: My Time Working for the Trumps
Trump That: the Story I Couldn’t Tell the Press
evidence: Grisham, who famously held no news briefings during her nine months as press secretary, has penned the ‘most frank and intimate portrait’ yet of the Trump presidency, said publisher HarperCollins. Her memoir is out on 5 October

question_sentence: The European Commission is under fire from tech giant Apple after setting out plans to make phone manufacturers do what in a bid to cut electronic waste?
choices: Use only recycled metal and plastic to make handsets
Make USB-C connectors the standard charging port for all phones
Put annual caps on the number of handsets sold in the EU
Release more software updates to make phones last longer
evidence: EU lawmakers aim to reduce waste by encouraging consumers to re-use existing chargers when buying new devices, but Apple and other critics argue that the proposed rule would harm innovation

question_sentence: The furlough scheme has ended after supporting a total of how many jobs across the UK since being launched in March last year?
evidence: The scheme was originally meant to run for only three months but was extended five times to help support workers in industries hit hard by the Covid-19 pandemic, before finally winding up on 30 September

question_sentence: Amid widespread panic over the UK’s fuel crisis, Boris Johnson has said that Britons should do what?
choices: “Use public transport or work from home if they can”
“Go about their business in the normal way”
“Cancel unnecessary journeys to cut demand for petrol”
evidence: The PM’s intervention didn’t stop the rest of world queueing up ‘to mock Britain’ over the shortages, said The Times. Russian channel NTV ridiculed ‘panic-ridden’ Britain, while Australia’s 9News said that ‘what’s being fuelled is rage’

question_sentence: How has Beethoven’s unfinished Tenth Symphony been completed 194 years after his death?
choices: By patching together newly found scores by Beethoven
With help from one of Beethoven’s musical descendants
Through a competition for modern-day composers
evidence: Using AI, a group of musicologists, composers and computer scientists have turned fragmentary sketches of the unfinished score into a completed work. The finished piece will premiere on 9 October in Bonn, where Beethoven was born

question_sentence: Which country voted to legalize same-sex marriage by a nearly two-thirds majority, becoming one of the last nations in Western Europe to do so?
evidence: Switzerland held the referendum, with 64.1% of the electorate voting in favor of same-sex marriage.

question_sentence: A port of entry in which Texas city has reopened after being forced to close due to a dramatic surge of immigrants encamped at the US-Mexico border?
evidence: The Del Rio port of entry in Texas has since reopened after thousands of mostly Haitian immigrants were removed from an encampment at the site, a situation that many have criticized as an unnecessary humanitarian crisis.

question_sentence: The American team won the Ryder Cup this week. The Ryder Cup is a biennial competition between European and American players in what sport?
evidence: The US golfers emerged on top with a 19-9 victory over the visiting Europeans, the biggest winning margin in Ryder Cup history.

question_sentence: R&B singer R. Kelly was convicted of racketeering and sex trafficking by a federal jury in New York. Generally speaking, what kind of crimes does the term racketeering refer to?
evidence: R. Kelly’s charge of racketeering included acts of bribery and sexual exploitation of a child. He also faces additional charges in cases in Illinois and Minnesota.

question_sentence: A new study found that the world’s first domesticated bird may have been this species, which is often called the world’s most dangerous bird.
evidence: The study found evidence that early hunter-gatherers on the island of New Guinea may have domesticated the southern cassowary – a large, flightless and hugely dangerous bird – as far back as 18,000 years ago.

question_sentence: TikTok says it hit a new milestone. How many users does the video app now claim to have worldwide?
evidence: TikTok now has over 1 billion active monthly users, according to a release from the company.

question_sentence: John Hinckley Jr. will be granted “unconditional release” after completing decades of extensive mental health treatment following his failed assassination attempt of which former US president?
evidence: Hinckley attempted an assassination of President Ronald Reagan in 1981. He was found not guilty by reason of insanity, spending nearly 30 years at a mental hospital and later moving in with his mother in 2016.

question_sentence: Britney Spears’ father, Jamie Spears, was suspended as conservator of her estate - a position he’s held for 13 years. What is the status of the conservatorship now?
choices: it’s been temporarily passed to someone else
it will be maintained by the judge
evidence: Following the suspension of Jamie Spears from the role, a Los Angeles judge designated a temporary replacement to oversee Britney Spear’s estimated $60 million estate.

question_sentence: How many new species of birds, fish, mussels and other wildlife will soon be declared extinct by the US Fish and Wildlife service?
evidence: Citing the direct, harmful impact from human activity and continued effects of climate change, the US Fish and Wildlife service announced that 23 species, including the ivory-billed woodpecker, are to be removed from the endangered species list and declared extinct.

question_sentence: Singer Shakira claimed on her Instagram Stories that, while on a walk in Spain with her son, something attacked them, snatched her purse and “destroyed everything” before running into the woods. What creatures allegedly committed the vicious act?
evidence: While attempting to get her son, Milan, to back her story up, Shakira claimed on Instagram that they were attacked and her purse stolen by two wild boars – a species that has reportedly caused similar incidents in the country over the years.
